data.text: He that keepeth the law bringeth offerings enough:
He that requiteth a good turn offereth fine flour;
To depart from wickedness is a thing pleasing to the Lord;
Thou shalt not appear empty before the Lord.
For all these things are to be done because of the commandment.
The offering of the righteous maketh the altar fat,
The sacrifice of a just man is acceptable,
Give the Lord his honor with a good eye,
In all thy gifts show a cheerful countenance,
Give unto the most High according as he hath enriched thee;
For the Lord recompenseth,
Do not think to corrupt with gifts: for such he will not receive:
He will not accept any person against a poor man,
He will not despise the supplication of the fatherless;
Do not the tears run down the widowâ€™s cheeks?
He that serveth the Lord shall be accepted with favor,
The prayer of the humble pierceth the clouds:
For the Lord will not be slack,
Till he have rendered to every man according to his deeds,
Mercy is seasonable in the time of affliction,
